HPI 8115 1995 Volvo 850 T5-R Estate (Cream Yellow)



For model year 1995, a high performance model of the Volvo 850, developed in part with Porsche, was released and designated the 850 T-5R. 1995 was the only year that the a model was badged as a "T-5R"; the following year, as Volvo recognized the vehicle's popularity, the model was renewed with the designation "850R".

The vehicle was based on the 850 Turbo, and upgrades boosted output an extra 18 hp for a total of 243 hp and 250 lb-ft of torque. The engine was mated to a 4-speed automatic transmission or 5-speed manual transmission, the latter of which was not available in the US. The T-5R was renowned as a sleeper car; despite its boxy, understated appearance, it boasted a drag coefficient of 0.29 and was capable of accelerating from 0 to 60 mph in 5.8 - 6.0 seconds. The top speed was electronically limited to 152.2 mph. The engine tuning was co-developed with Porsche, as was the transmission and other powertrain components. Porsche also aided in designing some of the interior, such as the Alcantara seat inserts.
